name: CreateModelAX2012
description: Does Create an Empty Model in an AX 2012 Environment
author: SDK4NET.de

inputs.name: configurationFileName
inputs.label: Server config file path (.axc)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The file path of the server configuration file.

inputs.name: modelName
inputs.label: Model name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the new model.

inputs.name: targetLayerName
inputs.label: Target layer name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The layer to create the model in. (optional)

inputs.name: definitionMode
inputs.label: Definition mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: How should the definition of the model be done?

inputs.name: manifestPropertyDisplayName
inputs.label: Display name (Manifest property)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The display name of the model. (optional)

inputs.name: manifestPropertyInstallMode
inputs.label: Install mode (Manifest property)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The install mode of the model. (optional)

inputs.name: manifestPropertyVersion
inputs.label: Version (Manifest property)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version of the model. (optional, Version is a four-part indicator, in the format Number.Number.Number.Number, for example, 6.0.0.0)

inputs.name: manifestFileName
inputs.label: Manifest file path (.xml)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies an XML file that identifies a model. Use the Get-AXModelManifest cmdlet with the -Xml parameter to output a sample manifest file. (optional)

instanceNameFormat: SDK4NET.de - Create an Empty Model within a Model store in AX2012: $(targetModelName)
